subject: Negotiation
title: The Endowment Effect
description: A quick win: understand The Endowment Effect.

hook.text: People given a free coffee mug demanded $7 to sell it. People without one offered only $3 to buy it. Same mug.

buildup.text: The endowment effect: people value things more simply because they own them.

discovery.text: Ownership ‚Äî even brief ‚Äî creates emotional attachment that inflates perceived value.

twist.text: Car dealers use test drives and free trials specifically to trigger the endowment effect.

climax.text: In negotiations, let the other side 'hold' or 'try' your proposal. Ownership makes them value it more.

punchline.text: Let them hold it and they won't want to let it go.

quiz.question: What is the endowment effect?
options: People value things more simply because they own them
